summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from November 13, 2020, summarizing major news stories across various categories including counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and other FBI news. A significant item within the briefing is a summary of a DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility report concluding that former U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta exercised 'poor judgment' but did not engage in professional misconduct when agreeing to the 2008 non-prosecution plea deal with Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, negotiated the 2008 non-prosecution plea deal with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta agrees to a non-prosecution plea deal with Jeffrey Epstein, sparing him from federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: DOJ OPR Report on Acosta Released
events.description: The Justice Department's Office of Professional Responsibility releases a report finding Alex Acosta exercised 'poor judgment' but committed no professional misconduct in the Epstein plea deal.

events.title: Ramsey Named New Portland FBI SAC
events.description: FBI Section Chief Kieran Ramsey is officially named the new Special Agent in Charge of the FBI's Portland, Oregon field office.

keyFacts: A DOJ internal review concluded former U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta used 'poor judgment' but did not engage in professional misconduct in agreeing to Jeffrey Epstein's 2008 plea deal.
The report found Acosta failed to ensure victims were notified about the related state plea hearing, a key point of criticism.
Senator Ben Sasse and victims' attorney Adam Horowitz strongly criticized the DOJ report's findings.
The FBI announced a leadership change in its Portland, Oregon field office, with Kieran Ramsey replacing the retiring Renn Cannon as Special Agent in Charge.
The document is an FBI news briefing covering a wide array of national and international news, with the Epstein/Acosta item appearing under the 'OTHER FBI NEWS' section.
